name: Euler Tour
description: Also called, eulerian circuit, or cycle, starts and ends at the same graph vertex, which means it uses each graph edge (degrees) exactly once
requirements: All vertices with non-zero degree are connected

name: Euler Trail
description: The Eulerian Trail (also called Eulerian Path) is a path in a finite graph that visits every edge exactly once. The path may be started and ended at different graph vertices
requirements: Every vertex should have an even degree or only two vertices should have odd degrees.
